subject: MyClass.class.getResource() problem with JUnit (Eclipse plugin)
msgSnippet: Hi all, After many search (Google and through this mailing list), I m still not able to find an answer to my question :-( Under Eclipse, I m testing my RMI
messageBody:
Hi all,

After many search (Google and through this mailing list), I'm still
not able to find an answer to my question :-(

Under Eclipse, I'm testing my RMI server which loads config from its
resources (stored with class and src files). In my @BeforeClass I'm
starting the RMI server as a Thread and then my tests are calling
methods from the RMI server. The problem is coming from my server
initialization which check its config using the following code:

MyClass.class.class.getResource("resources/myConfig.conf");

It works well when I don't Run the RMI server through Junit but when I
run it through Junit (I call the Constructor of the RMI server in my
Junit @BeforeClass), getResource returns null. I tried different ways
but all of them are returning null even if my sources and classes are
in the classpath:
-Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getResource("resources/myConfig.conf")
-ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader().getResource("resources/myConfig.conf")


Once I read that when a ClassLoader was executing class done on the
fly (not a concrete class with a main, but like the Eclipse Junit
class where Junit methods are linked to the Junit Test) it was not
possible to get a resource path to this class. Maybe it is the cause
of my issue ?

Any suggestion is welcome !

Thanks in advance and best regards.
